articles.title: Quantum 'echoes' reveal the potential of Google's quantum computer
articles.author: Science News
articles.fullContent:
Quantum 'echoes' reveal the potential of Google's quantum computer

Researchers claim Google's Willow quantum chip has achieved a verifiable quantum advantage, performing a calculation that is seemingly beyond the reach of classical computers but with a result that can be confirmed as correct.

This development marks a crucial step toward finding practical applications for quantum computers, moving the technology from theoretical to demonstrable advantage.

Data & Insights

The calculation, measuring a phenomenon called “quantum echoes,” runs 13,000 times faster on the Willow chip than on the Frontier supercomputer. The full set of calculations would take about 150 years on Frontier but took only days on Willow.

Broader Impact

Achieving a verifiable quantum advantage is a major milestone. It builds confidence in the scalability and accuracy of quantum systems, paving the way for future research into complex problems in fields like medicine, materials science, and cryptography that are intractable for even the most powerful supercomputers today.

Key Takeaways

  • Google's Willow chip has achieved a verifiable quantum advantage.
  • It performed a specific calculation 13,000 times faster than a top supercomputer.
  • This is a critical step towards practical real-world use of quantum computers.

articles.title: On this day in space: Oct. 22, 1992: Gene Roddenberry's ashes fly on Space S
articles.author: space.com
articles.fullContent:
On this day in space: Oct. 22, 1992: Gene Roddenberry's ashes fly on Space S

On This Day in Space, October 22, 1992, some of the ashes of "Star Trek" creator Gene Roddenberry were launched into orbit aboard the Space Shuttle Columbia.

This symbolic journey fulfilled Roddenberry's wish to have his remains travel through the cosmos that so heavily inspired his work. The shuttle mission, STS-52, carried the ashes in a small canister along with its primary payloads, honouring the legacy of a man whose vision of the future inspired millions to look to the stars.

Broader Impact

The event highlighted the deep connection between science fiction and real-world space exploration. Roddenberry's optimistic and inclusive vision for humanity's future in space has been cited by countless scientists, engineers, and astronauts as a primary source of their inspiration, demonstrating the powerful role storytelling plays in driving scientific progress.

Key Takeaways

  • A portion of Gene Roddenberry's ashes were flown into space on Oct 22, 1992.
  • The mission was carried out by the Space Shuttle Columbia (STS-52).
  • The act fulfilled Roddenberry's wish and symbolized the link between sci-fi and space exploration.

articles.fullContent:
JUJUTSU KAISEN: Execution Compilation Movie Reveals Exclusive IMAX Visual

In preparation for its release in Japan, the JUJUTSU KAISEN: Execution compilation movie has revealed a new visual for its IMAX screenings.

The film recaps the anime's popular Shibuya Incident arc and includes the first two episodes of the upcoming Culling Game arc, bridging the gap between seasons for fans.

Broader Impact

The movie will be released in Japan on November 7, with international release dates to follow. This includes a North American release on December 5, indicating the franchise's significant global appeal and the studio's commitment to its international fanbase.

Key Takeaways

  • A new IMAX visual has been released for the upcoming compilation movie.
  • The film recaps the Shibuya Incident arc and previews the Culling Game arc.
  • It will be released in Japan on Nov 7 and North America on Dec 5.

articles.title: European AI rising star Nexos AI raises €30M to unlock enterprise AI
articles.author: Tech.eu
articles.fullContent:
European AI rising star Nexos AI raises €30M to unlock enterprise AI

Vilnius-based nexos.ai has raised €30 million in a Series A round to help enterprises adopt AI securely and at scale.

The financing, co-led by Evantic Capital and existing investor Index Ventures, aims to address “Shadow AI” risks and eliminate barriers preventing enterprises from effectively using AI tools.

Broader Impact

The funding will be used to scale the platform and support expansion across Europe and North America. The company's focus on tackling core barriers to enterprise AI adoption, such as security and governance, positions it to become a key player in the growing market for safe and scalable AI solutions in the corporate sector.

Key Takeaways

  • Nexos.ai has raised €30 million in a Series A funding round.
  • The company focuses on secure and scalable AI adoption for enterprises.
  • Funding will be used to expand its platform across Europe and North America.

articles.title: FTC removes Lina Khan-era posts about AI risks and open source
articles.author: TechCrunch
articles.fullContent:
FTC removes Lina Khan-era posts about AI risks and open source

The Federal Trade Commission has deleted several Lina Khan–era blog posts that warned about artificial intelligence risks and debated the role of open-source and open-weights models.

The removal of posts titled "On Open-Weights Foundation Models", "Consumers Are Voicing Concerns About AI", and "AI and the Risk of Consumer Harm" followed the recent administration change. These posts had outlined the FTC's examination of real-world AI harms like fraud, impersonation, and discriminatory outcomes.

Broader Impact

The takedowns signal a significant shift in the agency's public stance on AI regulation. This repositions the FTC's approach and recasts how Washington talks about AI, competition, and consumer protection, potentially indicating a less aggressive regulatory posture in the near future.

Key Takeaways

  • The FTC has deleted several blog posts about the risks of AI.
  • The removed posts were from the tenure of former chair Lina Khan.
  • This action suggests a change in the agency's regulatory stance on AI.

articles.title: Virtual particles: How physicists' clever bookkeeping trick could underlie reality
articles.author: The Conversation
articles.fullContent:
Virtual particles: How physicists' clever bookkeeping trick could underlie reality

Virtual particles are a sophisticated mathematical tool used to describe the interactions between real subatomic particles and the forces of nature.

Invented by physicist Richard Feynman to make calculations about particle interactions more manageable, they are not real in the sense that they cannot be directly detected. They are an essential tool for describing three of the fundamental forces: electromagnetism, and the strong and weak nuclear forces.

Broader Impact

Although they are a mathematical construct, the calculations using virtual particles predict real-world effects with incredible accuracy. This success leads some scientists to believe they must have a real existence, challenging our fundamental understanding of reality and the nature of the universe.

Key Takeaways

  • Virtual particles are a mathematical tool, not directly detectable particles.
  • They were invented by Richard Feynman to simplify calculations of particle interactions.
  • Their high predictive accuracy has led to debate about their potential real-world existence.

articles.title: Watch comets Lemmon and SWAN make their closest approach to Earth live online on
articles.author: space.com
articles.fullContent:
Watch comets Lemmon and SWAN make their closest approach to Earth live online on

Stargazers can watch two comets, C/2023 A3 (Tsuchinshan-ATLAS) and C/2025 G3 (Lemmon), make their closest passes by Earth on October 20.

Both comets are expected to be visible with binoculars or a small telescope from a location with dark skies, offering a great opportunity for amateur astronomers.

Broader Impact

To make the event accessible to everyone, the Virtual Telescope Project will host a free livestream of the celestial event. This will allow a global audience to witness the comets' close approach through robotic telescopes, regardless of their location or local weather conditions.

Key Takeaways

  • Two comets, Lemmon and SWAN, made their closest approach to Earth on Oct 20.
  • The event was visible with binoculars or a small telescope in dark sky locations.
  • The Virtual Telescope Project hosted a free livestream for global viewing.

articles.title: Best star projectors for kids: Night lights, toys and more | Space
articles.author: Tantse Walter
articles.fullContent:
Best star projectors for kids: Night lights, toys and more | Space

A new guide rounds up the best star projectors for children, with options that serve as STEM kits projecting realistic night sky imagery, and others that act as ambient night-lights.

The guide offers a comprehensive list that includes reviews and analyses of various models to suit different needs and budgets, helping parents make informed decisions ahead of Black Friday 2025.

Broader Impact

These devices range from novelty designs to scientifically accurate planetariums, providing both educational value and a tool to help soothe a child before bed. They cater to a growing market for products that combine technology, education, and child wellness.

Key Takeaways

  • A guide has been released for the best star projectors for kids.
  • Options range from educational STEM kits to ambient night-lights.
  • The list helps parents choose a suitable model based on budget and features.

articles.title: How can Europe fight back against incursions by drone aircraft?
articles.author: Matthew Powell
articles.fullContent:
How can Europe fight back against incursions by drone aircraft?

Following a series of drone sightings around airports in Denmark and other European countries, an academic analysis explores the risks and how to counter the threat.

The risks posed by drone aircraft range from disruptions at civilian airports to potential military and civilian attacks, prompting an urgent need for effective countermeasures.

Broader Impact

Potential solutions include high-powered lasers like the UK's DragonFire system, specialized jamming technology, and combat aircraft. However, each method presents significant challenges, including the risk of falling debris from downed drones and the difficulty of targeting small, fast-moving objects, highlighting the complexity of modern aerospace security.

Key Takeaways

  • European nations are analysing the threat posed by drone incursions.
  • Potential solutions include lasers, jamming, and combat aircraft.
  • Each countermeasure comes with its own set of challenges and risks.

articles.title: Could the world's 1st private space telescope help find stars with habitable e
articles.author: space.com
articles.fullContent:
Could the world's 1st private space telescope help find stars with habitable e

The first commercial deep space astronomy telescope, named Mauve, is set to search for stars that could potentially host habitable exoplanets in their orbits.

Developed by London-based start-up Blue Skies Space, the Mauve telescope is a suitcase-sized satellite equipped with an ultraviolet spectrometer to monitor flaring stars.

Broader Impact

By tracking the intensity and frequency of stellar flares, the telescope will help scientists identify which stars are stable enough to allow for the emergence of life on orbiting planets and which are too volatile. This commercial approach to astronomical research could accelerate the search for life beyond Earth by providing targeted data to the scientific community.

Key Takeaways

  • The first private space telescope, Mauve, will search for habitable exoplanet systems.
  • It will monitor stellar flares to determine the stability of stars.
  • This commercial venture aims to accelerate the search for extraterrestrial life.

articles.title: Where the ridge meets the river photo of the day for Oct. 16, 2025
articles.author: NASA Earth Observatory
articles.fullContent:
Where the ridge meets the river photo of the day for Oct. 16, 2025

A stunning satellite image from Landsat 9 captures the Mazartagh Ridge and Hotan River in the Takla Makan Desert in western China, showcasing a unique geological crossroads.

The image, taken from 438 miles above Earth by the Operational Land Imager-2 (OLI-2), shows the ridge acting as a natural barrier against winds while the river, carrying glacial meltwater, appears as a dark thread through the arid landscape.

Broader Impact

This photograph reveals the deep and intricate connections between geology, climate, and history in one of the world's most arid regions. It serves as a valuable data point for scientists studying desertification, water resource management, and the long-term effects of climate change on remote ecosystems.

Key Takeaways

  • A Landsat 9 satellite image shows a unique geological feature in the Takla Makan Desert.
  • The image captures the intersection of the Mazartagh Ridge and the Hotan River.
  • It highlights the interplay of geology and climate in one of the world's most arid regions.
